Bank strike tomorrow: FBIOA launches protest against Narendra Modi govt’s banking, labour reforms Bank strike tomorrow: FBIOA launches protest against Narendra Modi govt’s banking, labour reforms The Fed of Bank of India Officer’s Associations have called a bank strike tomorrow for banks across India against the Narendra Modi-led government's monetary policy and reforms. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 27, 2017 7:54 PM Sanjoy Das. (ANI) 
The Fed of Bank of India Officer’s Associations (FBIOA) have called a bank strike tomorrow for banks across India against the Narendra Modi -led government’s monetary policy and reforms in the banking industry and labour laws. Sanjoy Das the Vice President of FBIOA in an interview with the media said, “Under United Forum of Bank Unions’ banner we have called for all India bank strike tomorrow. We are compelled to call the strike. It is against government’s monetary policy and reforms in banking industry & labour law.” Earlier in the week, the United Forum of Bank Unions had threatened to go on strike in order to pressurise the central government for various demands that include the accountability of top executives in view of the escalating bad loans.

The strike will affect the working of all the public sector banks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank , Bank of Baroda, ICICI, HDFC, Axis, Kotak Mahindra tomorrow. Demands of the works behind the strike include compensation for extra hours of work that was put by the employees ahead of Narendra Modi’s demonetisation move in November, adequate recruitment in all cadres, the initiation of process for the next wage revision of the bank employees accountability of top executives and recovery of bad loans. the demands also include action against all witful defaulters. 
Financial institution that will not be a part of the stike are National Organisation of Bank Workers and National Organisation of Bank Officers that are affiliated by the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh.
